question: Which country houses the "Reunion Hotspot"?
explanation: Reunion Hotspot is a volcanic hotspot that is currently located under the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France in the Indian Ocean. The Chagos-Laccadive Ridge and the southern part of the Mascarene Plateau are formed due to the volcanic activities of the Reunion Hotspot. Piton de la Fournaise, one of the most active volcanoes in the world, is located in the Reunion Hotspot.
